search_results.snippet: The front of a ship is called its "bow," and when someone on the vessel is moving towards its bow, that person is going "forward." When the ship itself is moving forward, it is going "ahead." The right side of the ship to someone on the ship facing the bow is called "starboard," while the left side is called "port."
